title: The Hyundai Seoul Store / Burdifilek
description: In celebration of its 50th anniversary, The Hyundai Department Store Group opened its largest store in Seoul. The Hyundai Seoul is part of a mixed-use complex combining business, shopping, and leisure in a single destination. The client's intent was to shape history by redefining the future of retail. The vision was to merge grand architecture, innovative and visually stimulating contemporary design, technology and inspire and contribute to social value by providing memorable experiences for its customers.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: Casa Gana / TOUCH Architect
description: Located in the serene surroundings of Khao Yai, a renowned suburban tourist destination just a three-hour drive from Bangkok, this site spans six hundred square wah. Surrounded by nature and offering stunning views of towering hills, it serves as an ideal location for a vacation villa to escape the chaos of the city and a wedding venue for intimate celebrations, providing privacy amidst an aesthetic ambiance. Due to the lower elevation of the construction site compared to its surroundings, subterranean stones must be removed to avoid the need for pile driving, with the stones repurposed as a retaining wall for the elevated construction site.
author: Hana Abdel

title: A New Home Overhanging The Water’s Edge In Alaska
description: Architecture firm Prentiss + Balance + Wickline has shared photos of a home they completed in Alaska, that overlooks inlet waters and is balanced on the edge of a rock wall. The home’s geometry is defined by two tall shed roof structures with a connector between them. Along the west side of the home, the […]

title: MacKay-Lyons Sweetapple Architects adds concrete extension to Quebec spa
description: Canadian studio MacKay-Lyons Sweetapple Architects has expanded a thermal spa and baths complex in Quebec, adding a concrete plinth that houses an outdoor swimming pool and a hidden relaxation room. The Balnea Spa and Thermal Reserve is tucked away close to the ski town of Bromont in the Appalachian Mountains, southeast of Montreal and north The post MacKay-Lyons Sweetapple Architects adds concrete extension to Quebec spa appeared first on Dezeen.

title: IARA piggybacks stone aqueduct with sheltered timber bridge in China
description: Architecture studio IARA has reinvigorated an abandoned aqueduct in Huangshan, China, by attaching a sheltered timber bridge on top of its stone structure. Named FW JI Covered Bridge on Aqueduct, the project in Fengwu Village is shortlisted in the infrastructure and transport project category of Dezeen Awards 2024.
